00006 class PeerNode:
00007     def __init__(self, ip_address, port = 55800):
00008         self.ip_address = ip_address
00009         self.proxy = None
00010         self.connected = False
00011         self.port = port
00012         self.connect()
00013 
00014     def getName(self):
00015         return self.ip_address
00016 
00017     def connect(self):
00018         self.proxy = xmlrpclib.Server("http://%s:%i" % 
00019                         (self.ip_address, self.port))
00020         try:
00021             self.proxy.test()
00022             self.connected = True
00023         except:
00024             self.connected = False
00025             self.proxy = None
00026 
00027         return self.connected
00028 
00029 
00030     def online(self):
00031         '''
00032         Test if node is connected. 
00033         If the node is online, then do a test call.
00034         If not online, then try to reconnect.
00035         '''
00036         if self.connected:
00037             try:
00038                 self.proxy.test()
00039                 return True
00040             except:
00041                 self.connected = False
00042                 self.proxy = None
00043                 return False
00044         else:
00045             # try to connect
00046             result = self.connect()
00047             return result

00056     '''

00067     def getYaml(self):
00068         try:
00069             import yaml
00070         except:
00071             import _yaml_ as yaml
00072 
00073         return yaml

00075 #-------------------------------------------#
00076     def fileArgs(self, yaml_file):
00077         '''
00078         Parse config files.
00079         '''
00080         yaml = self.getYaml()
00081         f = open(yaml_file, 'r')
00082         params = yaml.load(f)
00083         f.close()
00084 
00085         # parse any files from which the
00086         # yaml config is being inherited from
00087         if params.has_key('inherits'):
00088             inherit_params = {}
00089             for filename in params['inherits']:
00090                 # fill dictionary with inherited attributes
00091                 f = open('config/'+filename, 'r')
00092                 base_params = yaml.load(f)
00093                 for _key, _value in base_params.iteritems():
00094                     inherit_params[_key] = _value
00095                 f.close()
00096 
00097 
00098             # recursively inherits dictionaries
00099             def fillDict(_params, _inherit_params):
00100                 for _key, _value in _params.iteritems():
00101                     if type(_value) is dict and _inherit_params.has_key(_key):
00102                         fillDict(_value, _inherit_params[_key])
00103                     else:
00104                         _inherit_params[_key] = _value
00105 
00106             fillDict(params, inherit_params)
00107 
00108             # inherits only top level dictionaries
00109             #for _key, _value in params.iteritems():
00110             #    inherit_params[_key] = _value
00111 
00112             self.params = inherit_params                       
00113 
00114         else:
00115             self.params = params
00116 
00117 #-------------------------------------------#
00118     def exit(self):
00119         '''
00120         Kill running server.
00121         '''
00122         if self.server_thread:
00123             import time
00124             proxy = xmlrpclib.Server("http://localhost:%i" % self.params['port'])
00125             # The first call sets the kill flag
00126             proxy.__kill__()
00127             time.sleep(.1)
00128             # because of racing conditions we may have to call
00129             # kill again to terminate the server
00130             try:
00131                 proxy.__kill__()
00132             except:
00133                 pass
00134             del(proxy)
00135             self.server_thread.join()
00136

00139     def pingPeers(self):
00140         '''
00141         Create connections to each peer.
00142         '''
00143         from p2p import serverthread
00144         self.server_thread = serverthread.ServerThread()
00145         self.server_thread.start()
00146 
00147         if not self.peer_list:
00148             if self.params.has_key('peers'):
00149                 peer_list = []
00150                 for peer in self.params['peers']:
00151                     peer_list.append(PeerNode(peer))
00152 
00153                 self.peer_list = peer_list

00163     def setVar(self, name, value):
00164         '''
00165         Set variable in the attributes dictionary, or create new if var doesn't exist.
00166         directly.
00167         '''
00168         if name == 'crossover_prob':
00169             self.params['crossover']['prob'] = value
00170         elif name == 'mutation_prob':
00171             self.params['mutation']['prob'] = value
00172         elif name == 'population_size':
00173             self.params['population']['size'] = value
00174         else:
00175             self.params[name] = value

00179     def setVars(self, varNames, values):
00180         '''
00181         Sets variables from list in the attributes dictionary, or create new if var doesn't exist.
00182         directly.
00183         '''
00184         for i in xrange(len(varNames)):
00185             self.params[varNames[i]] = values[i]

00187 #-------------------------------------------#
00188     def getVar(self, name):
00189         '''
00190         Get variable from the attributes dictionary. To keep from accessing the dictionary
00191         directly.
00192         '''
00193         if name == 'crossover_prob':
00194             return self.params['crossover']['prob']
00195         elif name == 'mutation_prob':
00196             return self.params['mutation']['prob']
00197         elif name == 'population_size':
00198             return self.params['population']['size']
00199 
00200         else:
00201             if self.params.has_key(name):
00202                 return self.params[name]
00203             else:
00204                 print 'Variable %s does not exist!' % name
00205                 return None
00206 
00207 #-------------------------------------------#
00208     def getVars(self, varNames):
00209         '''
00210         Get list of variables from the attributes dictionary. To keep from accessing the dictionary
00211         directly.
00212         '''
00213         returnList = []
00214         for name in varNames:
00215             if self.params.has_key(name):
00216                 returnList.append(self.params[name])
00217             else:
00218                 print 'Variable %s does not exist!' % name
00219 
00220         return returnList

00230             self.setVars(args.keys(), args.values())
